report.title: Best ADHD Medication I Have Tried
report.author: ADHD Momma
report.bodytext: I was diagnosed with ADHD Inattentive Type (was ADD back then) when I was 7 years old. Immediately I was put on Ritlan, then Adderall later on. I have been having complaints about the side effects of Adderall (not lasting long enough, irritable, depressed, anti-social) so my doctor recommended Vyvanse. /n /n I was started out on a 30mg dose, which didn't really do much after the first couple days. Just last week my dose was increased to 50mg. I have to say, I love this medication! It lasts all day, unlike the Adderall which I had to take a second dose in the late afternoon. It helps me focus like crazy, the first few times I took it were intense, but now I am starting to get used to it and it is has such a nice, steady, even effect. /n /n 7:45am Ingest orally after eating a small breakfast. /n /n 8:00am Starting to feel perky and motivated, appetite decreasing. /n /n 8:10am Definitely feeling focused and motivated, in a great mood. Don't want to eat at all, but my mouth is very dry so I drink some water. /n /n 8:15am Medication is in full effect and I am ready to get some work done. Cleaning, laundry, planning meals for the kids, playing with the baby. Still no appetite but dry mouth is still there. /n /n 12:30pm Vyvanse is still in full effect and I am not hungry at all but I force myself to eat a bowl of cereal. /n /n 3:30pm Still going strong, I feel great and have accomplished quite a bit. Spent a couple hours blogging and editing photos, now to help older son with his homework. /n /n 5:30pm Peppy feeling starting to fade and my appetite is starting to increase. Still in a great mood. Making dinner for the family now. /n /n 8:00pm Effects of Vyvanse are now pretty much all gone, I feel a bit restless, but it is definitely chill time. /n /n 10:00pm Headed to bed, have to take Ambien most nights in order to fall asleep quickly. Without the Ambien I will usually toss and turn for 30 min or so.
